result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Henry W. Farrell was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence def is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.    Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.  No entry to any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale or distribution of alcohol; including but limited to bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents at summer festivals.
Remit costs.  Obtain/maintain full time employment.  AODA assessment and follow thru.  DNA sample - no surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
Concurrent with: any other suspension and retroactive to administrative suspension.
